page.title: 04BATTLE OF BRITAIN FLIGHT
page.content: The Battle of Britain Memorial Flight was started in 1957 at RAF Biggin Hill and transferred to RAF Coningsby in {1976}after being at Coltishall, Cottesmore and Scampton.It is composed of {5 Spitfires and 2 Hurricanes and {the only surviving Lancaster bomber {still flying.} One permanent officer and twelve vol- unteers run the Flight,the pilots all flying Phantom and Tornado jets as their normal work.Because the aircraft making up the flight are obsolete any spare parts for the Merlin and Gryphon engines which may be needed are specially made by {Rolls Royce}at {Derby.}The Flight is financed from the Air Defence Budget and is active on most summer weekends on 'fly pasts' at social events up and down the country as a memorial to the airmen who lost their lives in World War II.
